overview_of_class: This class will provide an introduction to modern cosmology, the science of the origin and evolution of the Universe. We will cover the standard Big Bang model, including: the thermal history of the Universe, Big Bang nucleosynthesis, the cosmic microwave background, and cosmic inflation. We will discuss the major energy components of the Universe, including the evidence for dark matter and dark energy. Time permitting, we will also cover the basics of structure formation.
name: Extragalactic Astrophysics and Cosmology
title: WCAS ASTRON 329-0-1 Extragalactic Astrophysics and Cosmology

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: The course will be evaluated using a midterm, a final exam, and problem sets. This course is open to both advanced undergraduates (Astro 329) and graduate students (Astro 429). There will be only one set of lectures, but students registering for Astro 429 will be assigned additional problems and the exams will be graded differently.
